verbose_text: Initially Vitamin D is hydroxylated in the liver to produce 25-hydroxyvitamin D and subsequently hydroxylation of 25-hydroxyvitamin D occurs, predominantly in the proximal tubule of the nephron in the kidney, to form 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin D. Given that there is a decline in renal function in aging, it would be expected that supplementation of vitamin D would be beneficial.
evidence: Vitamin D is hydroxylated in the liver to produce 25-hydroxyvitamin D
